div.l: Whan folk han laughen at this nyce caas
Of Absolon ⁊and hende Nicholas
Diuerse folk diuersely they seide
But for the more part they lough ⁊and pleide
Ne at this tale I saugh no man hym greue
But it were only Osewolde the Reue
Be cause he was of Carpenters crafte
A litell yre in his herte lafte
He gan to grucche ⁊and blamede it a lite
Sothike ꝙquod he full well couthe I yow quyte
With bleryng of a proude Millers ye
Yf that me list to speke of rybaudye
But yk am olde me list not pleie for age
Gras tyme is don my fodder is forage
This white top writeth myn olde yeres
Myn herte is also mouled as myn heres
But if I fare as doth an open ers
That ilke fruyte is euyr lenger the wers
Till it be roten in Mullok or in stre
We olde men I drede so fare we
Till we be rotyn kan we noght be ripe
We hoppen alweie while the worlde will pipe
For in our will ther stiketh euyr anaile
To haue an hoor heed ⁊and a grene taile
As hath a leek for though our myght be gon
Our will desireth folye euyr in oon
For whan we may nought doon than woll we speke
Yet in our aschen olde is fire reke
Four gleedes han we whiche I schall dyuyse
Auauntyng lyeng anger ⁊and ⁊and couetise
These four sprarkles longeth vn to elde
Our olde lymes mow well ben vn welde
But will ne schall not failen that is soth
And yet haue I alweie a coltis toth
As many a yere as it is passed henne
Syn that my tappe of lyf bigan to renne
For sikerly whan I was born a none
Deeth drough the tappe of lyf ⁊and lete it gone
And euyr sithen hath so the tappe ronne
Till that almost all empty is the tonne
The streem of lyf now droppeth on the chymbe
The seli tonge may well rynge ⁊and chymbe
Of wrecchidnes that passed is full yore
With olde folke saue dotage is no more
// Whan that our oost had herde this ʆsermonyng
He gan to speken as lordly as a kyng
He seide what amoıı̄unteth all this witte
